title: Yankees slug four HRs in 1st inning off Cortes
content: Former Yankees pitcher Nestor Cortes gave up first-inning home runs to Paul Goldschmidt, Cody Bellinger, Aaron Judge and Austin Wells in his return to the Bronx with the Brewers.

title: Grizz GM: No player input on call to fire Jenkins
content: Grizzlies general manager Zach Kleiman says he did not speak to anyone on the roster before firing Taylor Jenkins as coach.

title: St. John's Luis entering NBA draft, transfer portal
content: St. John's star RJ Luis Jr., the Big East Player of the Year, is declaring for the NBA draft and entering the transfer portal, his agent told ESPN.

title: Bills, CB Benford agree to 4-year, $76M extension
content: The Bills have agreed to terms with cornerback Christian Benford on a four-year, $76 million contract extension, his agents told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Paopao: S. Carolina should be 'punching first'
content: South Carolina guard Te-Hina Paopao says her team needs put and end to their slow starts and start "punching first" ahead of its Elite Eight showdown with Duke.

title: 2-time WNBA MVP Stewart re-signs with Liberty
content: Breanna Stewart has re-signed with the Liberty after she helped lead the franchise to its first WNBA championship last year.

title: Houston survives on 'beautiful' last-second play
content: A perfectly executed inbounds play gave No. 1 Houston a 62-60 win over Purdue and a spot in the Elite Eight.

title: 'Generational' talent Betts keeps No. 1 UCLA rolling
content: Lauren Betts had 31 points and 10 rebounds as UCLA rolled past Ole Miss 76-62 to advance to the Elite Eight for the first time since 2018.

title: NHL playoff watch: Guide to a pivotal 11-game Saturday
content: Here's what's at stake in each matchup, plus updated playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Palace book Wembley trip with win over Fulham
content: Eberechi Eze grabbed a goal and an assist as Crystal Palace beat London rivals Fulham 3-0 on Saturday to book their place in the FA Cup semifinals.

title: Ex-Timber awarded $20M in malpractice lawsuit
content: Former New Zealand international Jake Gleeson has won a medical malpractice lawsuit against Portland Timbers team doctor Richard H. Edelson, with a jury awarding him over $20 million.

title: Bayern hold off St. Pauli, keep title tilt on track
content: Leroy Sane scored twice in the second half as Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich were made to work hard for a 3-2 win over visitors St Pauli on Saturday.

title: Azpilicueta scores stunner in Atlético draw
content: Captain Javi Puado scored from the penalty spot to cancel out a first-half strike by Cesar Azpilicueta as relegation-threatened Espanyol held third-placed Atletico Madrid to a 1-1 draw in LaLiga on Saturday.

title: Newcastle throw open-top bus parade for cup win
content: Newcastle are celebrating the end of their 70-year weight for a major domestic trophy with an open-top bus parade through the city.

title: Brazil fires coach Dorival after loss to Argentina
content: Brazil has dismissed head coach Dorival Júnior following Tuesday's deflating loss to rivals Argentina, Brazil's Football Confederation (CBF) announced Friday.

title: Mateta wears protective cap on Palace return
content: Jean-Philippe Mateta made his first appearance since his ear was "destroyed" when he was named in Crystal Palace's starting XI on Saturday.

title: James blasts FIFA 'injustice' over León CWC axing
content: León captain James Rodríguez and coach Eduardo Berizzo urged FIFA on Friday to reconsider booting the Mexican team from the Club World Cup

title: Transfer rumors, news: Sesko eyes Arsenal, Man United over Bayern or Milan
content: RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko has caught the eye of Arsenal, Man United, Milan and Bayern. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Mikaela Mayer's jab, movement vs. Sandy Ryan's power
content: A boxing insider and a former opponent share their predictions for the Mikaela Mayer vs. Sandy Ryan rematch.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: Over 1,600 Dead, 3,400 Injured: Myanmar-Thailand Quakes Flatten Buildings
content: A massive earthquake struck Myanmar and parts of neighbouring Thailand, leaving a trail of destruction and a mounting death count. On Saturday evening, the death count in Myanmar and Thailand crossed 1,600, with 1,644 dead in Myanmar alone.

title: Live: India Steps Up Efforts, Hands Over 1st Set Of Relief Aid To Myanmar
content: The death count from a massive earthquake in Myanmar has jumped to 1,644, with 3,408 people injured, the country's ruling junta said Saturday.

title: Foreign Fund, Salaries In Lakhs To Girls: Noida Couple's Porn Racket Busted
content: A couple in Noida, foreign funding, adult entertainment - a major online pornography racket was busted, uncovering an illegal network that stretched beyond international borders.

title: Centre Okays Odisha IAS Officer Sujata Karthikeyan's Request For Retirement
content: The Centre has approved Odisha cadre Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer Sujata R Karthikeyan's request to be relieved from service.

title: 21-Year-Old NEET Aspirant Dies By Suicide Near Chennai, Opposition Slams DMK
content: A 21-year-old student preparing for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) for medical admissions has died by suicide near Chennai.

title: Trying To Find Love, Noida Man Loses Rs 6.3 Crore Life Savings
content: Daljit Singh matched with a woman named Anita, who allegedly convinced him to invest in certain companies on the pretext of earning huge profits.

title: Is Elon Musk Planning To Quit Trump's DOGE Team? Here's What He Said
content: US President Donald Trump's billionaire ally Elon Musk has signalled that he is planning to step down from his cost-cutting role at the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) by the end of May after reducing the US deficit by $1 trillion.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: IPL 2025 LIVE: "F*** Off" - Hardik, Sai Kishore In Brutal Staredown
content: Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: MI's chase vs GT has fallen apart, and they are staring at a second consecutive defeat.

title: 'Saw NRI Man Hitting Saif Ali Khan': Actor Amrita Ladak On Hotel Brawl Case
content: Bollywood actor Amrita Arora Ladak on Saturday deposed as a witness before a court here in the case concerning Saif Ali Khan, who was accused of attacking an NRI businessman and his father-in-law at a five-star hotel in 2012.

title: How To Create Studio Ghibli-Inspired Images For Free Without ChatGPT
content: Whether it's Instagram or X, our social media feeds, at large, are in anime mode! Studio Ghibli portraits have taken the internet by storm in the last 48 hours, with people turning everything -  into Japanese anime-inspired art.

title: Delhi Box Bed Murder Case Cracked, 2 Arrested, Say Police
content: A day after a woman's decomposed body was found in a box bed in a flat in Delhi's Shahdara, police said they have cracked the case with the arrest of the house's owner and one of his accomplices.

title: "Will Probably Never Come Back": Tourist's Viral Post On Goa Horror
content: Two locals on a scooty allegedly followed the tourist to the railway station, blocked his car and threatened to smash his windshield.

title: How Trump's Tariff War Could Leave Millions Of Americans Without Toilet Paper
content: US President Donald Trump's proposed tariffs on Canada could trigger an unexpected crisis in America, leading to panic-buying seen at the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: "Nothing Really Matters Anymore": Fans Upset Over Studio Ghibli-Style AI Art
content: OpenAI said the latest GPT‑4o model takes a "conservative approach" to mimic the aesthetics of individual artists.

title: On Camera, Noida School Teacher Thrashes Special Needs Child, Case Filed
content: A case has been filed against a teacher from a Noida school for allegedly losing his temper at a special child and repeatedly hitting him because he couldn't follow along with a lesson and answer questions.

title: Crisis on crisis: Devastating earthquake adds to humanitarian woes of war-torn Myanmar
content: A powerful 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar has resulted in at least 694 deaths and significant infrastructure damage. The country, already facing civil war and severe humanitarian crises, now suffers even more with massive displacement and dwindling resources, especially after recent US aid freezes.

title: Tufts luck: 2 Indian-Americans in eye of ICE storm over detention of Turkish scholar
content: Tufts University President Sunil Kumar and Judge Indira Talwani face criticism amid the detention and potential deportation of Turkish scholar Rumeysa Ozturk. Students and lawmakers decry the actions of federal authorities and demand stronger institutional support and condemnation of the Trump administration's policies.

title: India, US conclude first round of talks for trade deal
content: India and the US completed their initial discussions on a bilateral trade agreement, aiming to finalize the first part by fall 2025. The negotiations focus on lowering tariffs and non-tariff barriers to enhance market access and deepen supply chains, aligning with shared goals of growth and job creation.

title: Rohit Sharma becomes fourth batter to smash 600 fours in IPL history
content: In the IPL 2025 clash at Ahmedabad, Rohit Sharma reached a milestone of 600 fours, becoming the fourth player to achieve this. Despite being dismissed for 8 runs by Mohammed Siraj, his achievement secures his place in IPL history. The top three players with most fours are Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli and David Warner.

title: Myanmar earthquake: Why a 33-storey high-rise in Thailand collapsed?
content: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar caused over 1,600 deaths and significant damage also in Thailand. A high-rise under construction in Bangkok collapsed, raising concerns over the structural integrity of buildings. Experts warn that many older buildings, especially in Bangkok, may not be earthquake-resistant.

title: Donald Trump imposes 25% import tariff on car imports; Musk responds
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on auto imports and parts, which takes effect on April 3. This decision targets foreign-made cars, light trucks, and key auto parts. Elon Musk highlighted that these tariffs would increase the cost of parts in Tesla cars sourced from other countries.

title: Op Brahma: What aid is India sending to quake-hit Myanmar?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences to Myanmar's military chief following a 7.7-magnitude earthquake. India launched 'Operation Brahma', sending over 80 NDRF personnel and crucial supplies to assist in the aftermath, showing solidarity with its neighbour in this humanitarian crisis.

title: When is Eid-ul-Fitr in India? Saudi Arabia moon sighting confirms Eid date
content: Eid-ul-Fitr, marking the end of Ramadan, will be celebrated on March 30, 2025, in Saudi Arabia, while India will observe it on March 31, 2025. This festival involves communal prayers, festive meals with family, and charitable giving, reflecting gratitude and community spirit.

title: 'Mamata is a traitor': Adhikari seeks action over Bengal CM's UK remarks
content: West Bengal's opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari has accused CM Mamata Banerjee of treason over her remarks during a UK visit where she appeared to downplay India's economic growth. Adhikari urged EAM Jaishankar to ban Banerjee's foreign visits and investigate her statements.

title: 15-hour-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Fake ISI mark products seized
content: The Bureau of Indian Standards has conducted extensive raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi targeting counterfeit and substandard products. Thousands of items, including geysers, food mixers, electrical appliances, and sports footwear lacking proper ISI certification, were seized with an estimated value of Rs 70 lakh.

title: Watch: Siraj dismisses Rohit for first time in IPL with a stunning delivery
content: Gujarat Titans' Mohammed Siraj delivered a brilliant ball to dismiss Mumbai Indians' Rohit Sharma for the first time in IPL history. GT posted a total of 196/8, with strong performances from Sai Sudharsan, Shubman Gill, and Jos Buttler. Rohit was dismissed for 8, leaving MI stunned during their IPL 2025 match in Ahmedabad.

title: 'Close meat stalls for Navratri', says Nirupam; NCP (SCP) calls it 'tamasha'
content: Shiv Sena’s Sanjay Nirupam has urged Mumbai Police to close street-side Shawarma and non-vegetarian stalls during Navratri, citing respect for Hindu sentiments. The Nationalist Congress Party criticized the request, calling it a distraction from genuine issues.

title: John Tortorella’s potential next chapters: Bruins, Penguins, and Sabres
content: Brian Foisy from BetMGM suggests that 66-year-old John Tortorella, the oldest active head coach in the NHL, could potentially fit teams like Boston Bruins, Pittsburgh Penguins, Minnesota Wild, Nashville Predators, and Buffalo Sabres. Each team offers unique advantages and challenges for Tortorella, who has a history of success in various teams but struggled with the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: 60 inspiring Eid Mubarak wishes, quotes and messages
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated with gratitude, prayer, and generosity towards the needy. Muslims worldwide come together to offer special prayers, enjoy festive meals, and exchange gifts. This year, it will be observed from the evening of March 31, 2025, to April 1, 2025.

title: UP CM bans meat sales near religious sites during Navratri
content: The Uttar Pradesh government, led by CM Yogi Adityanath, has issued strict directives to shut down illegal slaughterhouses and ban meat sales within a 500-meter radius of religious sites. A state-wide ban on animal slaughter and meat sales will also be enforced on April 6, 2025, during Ram Navami.

title: 'Digging with bare hands': Rescuers 'helpless' as trapped quake victims 'cry for help'
content: A devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar has killed over 1,000 people, injured thousands, and left many trapped under rubble. Rescue efforts are hindered by a lack of heavy machinery. The military government has appealed for international aid, with initial assistance arriving from India and China.

title: Tamim Iqbal opens up on heart attack, thanks trainer for timely CPR
content: Former Bangladesh cricket captain Tamim Iqbal has shared his gratitude after being discharged from the hospital following a heart attack. Iqbal experienced chest discomfort during a match, leading to an urgent angioplasty surgery. He credited trainer Yakub Chowdhury Dalim for providing timely CPR that saved his life and expressed his appreciation for the support and prayers.

title: Eid-ul-Fitr 2025 in Saudi Arabia: Moon sighting, date & public holidays
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and its date in Saudi Arabia will be determined by the moon sighting. Expected around March 30, 2025, this celebration includes prayers, family gatherings, special meals, and charity. Public holidays last for three to four days, allowing people to fully immerse in festivities and togetherness.

title: Shubman Gill becomes second-fastest to 1000 IPL runs at a venue
content: Gujarat Titans captain Shubman Gill became the second-fastest player to reach 1000 IPL runs at a single venue during a match against Mumbai Indians. He achieved this milestone in just 20 innings at Ahmedabad’s Narendra Modi Stadium, only behind Chris Gayle. Gill’s performance, along with Sai Sudharsan, helped GT reach 66/0 in the powerplay.

title: Videos show chaos after Naypyitaw airport control tower collapses in quake
content: A 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Myanmar's Naypyitaw, causing the airport's control tower to collapse and halting air traffic. The death toll exceeded 1,000, with extensive damage recorded in Mandalay and beyond. Ongoing civil conflict complicates rescue efforts, even as international aid arrives.

title: 'Views badha lo': Aakash Chopra slams fake Dhoni commentary video
content: Aakash Chopra condemned a fan for editing his commentary to create a misleading video of MS Dhoni in the IPL 2025 match between CSK and RCB. The fake clip falsely linked Chopra's words to Dhoni’s arrival instead of his six. Despite CSK's defeat, Dhoni impressed with 30 not out, setting a new record for the team.

title: Maha U-turn? No crop loan waiver for now, says dy CM Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged farmers to repay crop loans by March 31, emphasizing that election promises like loan waivers depend on future decisions and current circumstances. He assured 0% interest loans to ease the burden and highlighted the significant financial commitments the state faces.

title: 'My wife has 3-4 boyfriends': Gwalior man fears 'Meerut-like' murder plot
content: Amit Kumar Sen from Gwalior protested, accusing his wife and her boyfriends of planning to murder him, claiming they already killed his son. Despite multiple complaints, he alleges no police action has been taken, stressing the need for protection and investigation.

title: Watch: Heartwarming Dhoni-Raina reunion steals the spotlight
content: MS Dhoni and Suresh Raina's heartfelt reunion during the CSK vs RCB match delighted fans, while Dhoni became CSK's highest run-scorer, overtaking Raina's record. Despite Dhoni's efforts, CSK fell short of RCB's score, ending RCB's 17-year winless streak at Chepauk. The emotional evening also saw a warm moment between Virat Kohli and Raina.

title: Lahore-born New Zealand batter slams fastest fifty on ODI debut
content: New Zealand's Muhammad Abbas set a new record with the fastest debut fifty in ODIs, scoring 52 off 26 balls against Pakistan at McLean Park. The 21-year-old's impressive performance surpassed Krunal Pandya’s previous record. Supported by Mark Chapman's century, New Zealand secured a 73-run victory, taking a 1-0 lead in the series.

title: How killer techie fooled tenant, misled cops after killing wife in Bengaluru
content: Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar admitted to killing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, after a dispute over her job search and unemployment issues. Following the murder, he falsely informed a tenant that Gouri had committed suicide. Rakesh planned to surrender but was apprehended by police beforehand.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli shoves CSK's Khaleel in front of Dhoni
content: The IPL match between RCB and CSK was marked by a heated confrontation between Virat Kohli and Khaleel Ahmed. RCB secured a 50-run victory, breaking their Chepauk jinx. Kohli's frustration with Khaleel overshadowed the win, sparking fan discussions. RCB's batting and bowling performances were highlighted by contributions from Rajat Patidar, Tim David, Josh Hazlewood, and Yash Dayal.

title: What to eat, foods to avoid and food rules to follow during Surya Grahan
content: A partial solar eclipse, the first of 2025, will occur on March 29. It will be visible in the United States and India at specific times. The event is considered spiritually significant, especially in India, where dietary guidelines recommend sattvic foods and avoiding cooked food, non-vegetarian items, and stimulants.

title: Centre vs X: Govt slams Musk's platform for calling 'Sahyog' censorship tool
content: The Centre has criticised social media platform X for calling the 'Sahyog' portal a censorship tool, describing the claim as unfortunate and condemnable. It emphasized Section 69A's authority for blocking orders under specific conditions and defended the portal's role in addressing unlawful content.

title: 'Swift heartbroken, devastated over custody battle involving her godson'
content: Taylor Swift, godmother to Jaime King's son Leo Thames, remains supportive despite King's recent custody loss due to addiction struggles. Swift is committed to honoring her godmother role during King's recovery, highlighting her unwavering loyalty to personal relationships.

title: '10 times better': AB de Villiers praises RCB's squad balance
content: RCB's improved squad balance has been hailed by AB de Villiers after their impressive start in IPL 2025. With significant contributions from players like Bhuvneshwar Kumar, RCB have secured consecutive away victories against CSK and KKR. The team's depth and chemistry are major factors in their strong performance and promising start to the season.

title: Japan transforms cow dung into eco-friendly fuel for vehicles
content: Japan is using cow dung to create fuel for vehicles, reducing carbon emissions and managing agricultural waste. In Shikaoi, cow manure is converted into hydrogen for farm equipment and local businesses. This innovative process has caught global attention, with similar projects already being implemented in other regions. This technology presents a promising future for clean, renewable energy.

title: Rohit: 'Imagine if we'd won the final against Australia as well'
content: Rohit Sharma reflects on India's resilience and shift in mindset that led to impressive runs in ICC tournaments over the past nine months. Despite some setbacks, including a rare home Test series loss and a tough IPL season, India won the ICC Champions Trophy and T20 World Cup under his leadership.

title: 'Resolving conflict must be national priority': Rahul meets Manipur leaders
content: Rahul Gandhi met Manipur leaders amid ongoing violence and criticized PM Modi for not visiting the state. He urged for a national priority in resolving the crisis. Manipur has been under President's rule since February after the chief minister resigned due to ethnic violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zo tribes, resulting in over 250 deaths.

title: 'Not a terrorist': Sanjay Raut demands special protection for Kamra
content: Sanjay Raut demands special protection for comedian Kunal Kamra, who faces multiple legal cases over remarks about Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. He compares Kamra's situation to that of Kangana Ranaut, who received security after a dispute with Shiv Sena, and calls for government intervention.

title: Man kills 5-month-old twin daughters in Raj over desire for son; arrested
content: In a tragic incident in Sikar district's Neem Ka Thana town, Ashok Kumar allegedly killed his nearly 5-month-old twin daughters due to his desire for a son. The crime was reported by the twins' mother, Anita, who revealed a history of harassment. Kumar buried the bodies, and police arrested him after being alerted by Anita's brother.

title: Almost 30% of MHA’s takedown notices to X target posts on Union Ministers, government agencies
content: MHA targeted 1.1 lakh pieces of content this year; notices sent on X posts mocking PM, manipulated video of the HM, satirical video on the MoS for Home; police say SAHYOG portal still in trial stage

title: Park for geriatric patients, aged visitors inaugurated at Vellore GH
content: The need for the park was felt because most of the patients in the unit do not have much physical movement due to space crunch, says the heath official

title: 10 labourers from Bengal kidnapped in Tamil Nadu; rescued in inter-State operation
content: The 10 abducted men were reportedly from Murshidabad and Birbhum districts of West Bengal and headed towards Kerala for work

title: PM visiting Nagpur because RSS is behind election victory, says Congress MLA
content: Move to distribute Saugat-e-Modi kits during Eid, Baisakhi and Easter reflects change in RSS ideology, he says

title: MMU decries ‘religious interference’ in Kashmir
content: Conglomerate expresses resentment over decision to disallow Shab-e-Qadr prayers and Jumat-ul-Vida congregational prayers at the historic and central place of worship, Jama Masjid

title: Jobs in Deocha Pachami being given to Trinamool aides, says BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari
content: The LOP made allegations against Trinamool Rajya Sabha MP Samirul Islam who refuted the charges and said that since work at Deocha Pachami has been going on smoothly, the LOP is making baseless allegations to mislead the people

title: CBI convicts Bihar former Minister and four others in Bitumen scam case
content: The case is related to alleged transportation of bulk Bitumen from Haldia to Road Construction Department (RCD) Hazaribagh via Barauni; Investigation revealed that no Bitumen was transported at all

title: ‘I rushed down 40 floors in 7.5 minutes,’ recalls Thailand earthquake survivor
content: ‘It was the worst time of my life. I was petrified,’ survivor said, ‘Over 1,500 people came down with me. Many had left their phones in their offices in that hurry. Some were without shoes.’

title: Fish and meat shops in Varanasi to remain closed during Navratri
content: The decision has drawn strong criticism from a section of corporators, who argued it will impact the livelihoods of thousands of people

title: ASHAs to step up protest in front of Secretariat
content: They will express their protest by chopping off their hair on the 50th day of their agitation demanding better remuneration

title: Attempts to incite communal strife during Eid and Ram Navami, says WB police
content: The situation at Mothabari in Malda, where clashes were reported between two communities, has returned to normal. Eighteen cases have been lodged in connection to the incident, and 61 people have been taken in custody, police sources said

title: NTPC awaits PPA with Telangana, other States to begin work on 2,400 MW plants in Ramagundam
content: Plans to tap into Coal India arm SECL for feedstock as Singareni Collieries coal price is comparatively high

title: SC notice on plea challenging the use of GeM to outsource public employment
content: Dakshin Railway Employees Union files plea on termination of 152 sanitary workers replaced by outsourced labour hired through GeM portal; SC directs Railways to use the workers’ services while case is pending

title: No attempt should be made to divide nation in the name of language: Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh expressed concern over Tamil Nadu government prioritising opposition to Hindi over providing education in Tamil for crucial fields like medicine and engineering

title: Ministers often visit Delhi citing ‘official purpose’ but meet Congress central leaders
content: They seem to be keen to demonstrate their loyalty to the high command to ensure a safe berth in the Cabinet in the event of a change of guard or reshuffle of the ministry

title: UG student held for alleged impersonation during Plus One improvement exam in Kozhikode
content: The incident reportedly occurred at RAC Higher Secondary School, Katameri, during the improvement exam for English language

title: MGNREGA workers in heatwave-hit Kalyana Karnataka demand slashing mandatory work hours in summer months
content: In previous years, the Union government provided relief by reducing the mandatory workload for full wages during April and May, but an order in this regard is still awaited this year

title: JAC formed as mystery shrouds Pastor Praveen Pagadala’s death
content: The committee is calling for the release of CCTV footage and the post-mortem report, while legal experts push for an independent investigation

title: Lokesh bats for reforms in TDP to infuse young blood
content: Leaders should either go to the next level after serving two terms in their positions, or take a break to let freshers come in from time to time, he says, adding that he is prepared to make way for others having held the current post for the fourth term

title: BBMP to implement Climate Action Plan in select wards, focus on energy efficiency and parks
content: These initiatives aim to bring climate-focused interventions to the grassroots level, ensuring sustainable urban development across Bengaluru

title: Prabhotsavam held at Srisailam
content: Thousands of devotees participate in the Prabhotsavam of Lord Mallikarjuna Swamy and Goddess Bhramarambha taken out on the four ‘mada’ streets of the temple

title: Maharashtra government sanctions ₹13.46 crore for Tukaram Omble memorial
content: Mr. Omble was a Mumbai Police sub-inspector who was posthumously awarded the Ashok Chakra, India’s highest peacetime gallantry award, for his bravery during the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.

title: KAU unveils ₹258.53-cr deficit Budget for 2025-26
content: Financial assistance for postgraduate and research students as well as allocations for Rural Agricultural Work Experience programme, library enhancement, and various educational initiatives, have been included in the Budget

title: Kerala University under fire as 71 MBA students ordered to retake examination amid loss of answer sheets during evaluation
content: The answer scripts of the Project Finance paper, held in May 2024, went missing from a contract lecturer

title: State-of-the-art blood bank inaugurated in Tirupati
content: The new facility is not just a blood bank, but also doubles up into a central laboratory, stem cell and molecular research centre

title: Thrissur honours winners of State school arts fete
content: At Suvarnolsavam, an event organised by the district administration, the General Education dept, and the district panchayat, students urged to address problems in society through their creativity

title: Lord Kodandarama rides ‘Simha Vahanam’ and ‘Muthyapu Pandiri Vahanam’ on third day of Brahmotsavams
content: Pedda Jeeyangar and Chinna Jeeyangar, the senior and junior pontiffs of TTD led the procession, along with the Sri Kodandarama Swamy temple officials

title: BJP govt. waived loans of ₹16 lakh crore for corporate giants but refused to release MNREGS funds, says Speaker
content: This government at the Centre is only for the rich and the super-rich and not for the poor and the poorest of the poor, says Appavu at the inauguration of Kalai Sangamam

title: Assam scribe Dilwar Hussain Mozumder released on bail
content: He was arrested twice after covering a protest against the alleged financial irregularities in a State-run bank

title: ITDA reaches out to Muria tribespeople at Jaggaram settlement in Alluri Sitharama Raju district
content: In response to a report published in The Hindu, Project Officer Apoorva Bharat visits the settlement and promises steps to set up a primary school, issue Date of Birth certificates to children, and complete Aadhaar enrolment process soon

title: M.P.’s BJP government “mocking” unemployed youth by calling them “aspirational”: Congress
content: State employment portal says there are more than 29 lakh “Akankshi Yuva” in M.P.; CM Mohan Yadav says unemployment cannot be eradicated through government jobs, emphasises self-reliance, entrepreneurship

title: Leopard sightings at Chalakudy: thermal drones to be deployed for search
content: Emergency meeting recommends installing additional CCTV cameras and organising a search operation with the support of the public on Monday

title: Congress alleges 140 women raped, 40 murdered in one-year count in Tripura
content: Congress leaders attended a rally held by the party’s women’s wing to protest against alleged atrocities on women in Tripura

title: Four VROs suspended in Chittoor district
content: Suspended VROs are from Lakkanapalli in Baireddipalli mandal, Ammapalle in Karvetinagaram mandal, Gandrajupalli in Gangavaram mandal, and Agaram in Nindra mandal respectively

title: Historian MyNaa Swamy to receive Ugadi Award
content: The renowned historian and archaeologist honoured for his outstanding contributions to historical research and social service

title: TDP changed the political landscape of A.P., says Transport Minister
content: Addressing the party cadres at the 43rd foundation day of the party, Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy says that the party has crossed many a milestone in development, welfare, and social justice during the last 43 years

title: IOS Sagar to set sail from Kochi to the Indian Ocean Region with personnel of nine navies
content: The crew of India and nine friendly countries in Asia and Africa will jointly operate the vessel as part of a six-week-long mission including watch keeping and surveillance. Personnel are undergoing training at SNC Kochi and the vessel will be flagged off from Karwar on April 5

title: Kerala Water Authority gearing up to meet April and May water demand in Thiruvananthapuram city
content: Officials are keeping their fingers crossed with regard to summer temperatures, its impact on demand and summer rainfall volumes

title: V. K. Pandian’s wife takes voluntary retirement from IAS
content: Sujata Rout Karthikeyan, who led the Mission Shakti department under the BJD government, was accused by the BJP of influencing women self-help groups into supporting the BJD

title: Plan to develop IT hub near Kozhikode railway station, says Union Minister George Kurian
content: 27,100 sq. ft plot on the western side of the station will be developed as the IT hub, says George Kurian

title: SPV to spearhead mega road infra projects worth ₹73,200 crore over next 5 years
content: The budget said a Detailed Project Report has been prepared for a tunnel road between Hebbal and Silk Board at a cost of ₹17,780 crore, “set to be implemented this year”. DPR is also underway for another tunnel between K.R. Puram and Mysuru Road.

title: South Africa most dangerous country to drive, India ranks 49th among 53 surveyed
content: For the fourth year in a row, Norway is the safest country in the world for driving, while South Africa maintained its last position in the list for the second consecutive year

title: Green tag for six tourism destinations in Munnar
content: Officials at  Munnar Hydel Park, Upcycle Park, Botanical Garden, Rose Garden, Children’s Park, and Eravikulam National Park have been directed to ensure that green protocol is complied with

title: Constable facing criminal charges suspended in Annamayya district
content: Accused found to be involved in five criminal cases, including two at the Chinnamandem police station in 2017, and an attempted murder case at Ramapuram police station in 2018, among others

title: Main accused arrested in gang-rape case in Raebareli
content: Police have also booked another man who allegedly threatened the woman over phone of consequences if she told anyone about the inciden

title: Collector moots action plan to boost dairy production in Chittoor
content: Strengthening the dairy sector will also create a sustainable income for the farmers and help them overcome the hardships faced due to the unpredictable climatic conditions in agriculture, says Sumit Kumar

title: Meghalaya regional party suspends MLA, four others
content: The Voice of the People Party cited anti-party activities to take action against Adelbert Nongrum, who represents the North Shillong Assembly constituency

title: ED files chargesheet in Mukkunnimala illegal granite mining case
content: Chargesheet filed against 12 accused in a case pertaining to corruption in converting plantation land to granite quarries

title: DMK stages protest in Kovilpatti over unpaid job scheme funds
content: Kanimozhi leads the protest accusing the Union government of not keeping its promise of releasing ₹4,034 crore due to Tamil Nadu to enable payment of wages

title: Farmer’s daughter topped Bihar Board matriculation exam
content: Altogether 15,58,077 students appeared in the exam out of which 8,05,392 were girls and 7,52,685 were boys

title: Expert picks, best bets: Moreno's path to victory over Erceg at UFC Fight Night
content: Brandon Moreno makes his first Octagon appearance of 2025 . the former two-time men's flyweight champion takes on Steve Erceg . moreno, no. 3 in the divisional rankings, lost the title to Alexandre Pantoja in July 2023 .

title: 2025 preview: Skip Holtz looks to keep Birmingham on top, Bob Stoops takes aim
content: the Birmingham Stallions beat the San Antonio Brahmas to win the 2024 UFL championship . "that's how we've been able to win," coach Skip Holtz said earlier this month . the stallions have gone 26-4 in the past three regular seasons .

title: Your guide to the final men's Sweet 16 games: Game winners, keys to the Elite Eight
content: the four no. 1 seeds make up half of the remaining NCAA tournament field . the two-seed Tennessee Volunteers and Michigan State Spartans are also moving on . all four winners of Friday's games will play again Sunday .

title: Women's tournament: Saturday and Sunday betting odds, lines, spread
content: the 2025 women's basketball tournament is underway, with 12 teams looking to make their mark on history . the UCLA Bruins clinched the overall no. 1 seed after a resounding Big 10 tournament win . across the bracket is reigning champion south Carolina .

title: Your guide to the women's Sweet 16: Pair of 1-seeds advance, Morrow and Betts star
content: aneesah Morrow scores 30 points and grabs 19 rebounds to power LSU to the Elite Eight . the third-seeded LSU Tigers upended no. 2 seed NC State in the Spokane 1 Regional . we're tracking every game as the march to the final four continues .
